(Exact name of registrant as specified in its charter) &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Delaware &nbsp; 001-38449 &nbsp; 35-2617337 (State or other jurisdiction of incorporation) &nbsp; (Commission File Number) &nbsp; (IRS Employer Identification No.) &nbsp; 1320 Ridder Park Drive San Jose, California &nbsp; 95131 (Address of principal executive offices) &nbsp; (Zip Code) Registrant&#146;s telephone number, including area code: (408) 433-8000 &nbsp; &nbsp; Check the appropriate box below if the Form 8-K filing is intended to simultaneously satisfy the filing obligation of the registrant under any of the following provisions: &nbsp; &#9744; Written communications pursuant to Rule&nbsp;425 under the Securities Act (17 CFR 230.425) &nbsp; &#9744; Soliciting material pursuant to Rule&nbsp;14a-12 under the Exchange Act (17 CFR 240.14a-12) &nbsp; &#9744; Pre-commencement communications pursuant to Rule&nbsp;14d-2(b) under the Exchange Act (17 CFR 240.14d-2(b)) &nbsp; &#9744; Pre-commencement communications pursuant to Rule&nbsp;13e-4(c) under the Exchange Act (17 CFR 240.13e-4(c)) Indicate by check mark whether the registrant is an emerging growth company as defined in Rule 405 of the Securities Act of 1933 (&#167;230.405) or Rule 12b-2 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (&#167;240.12b-2). Emerging Growth Company &#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section&nbsp;13(a) of the Exchange Act. &#9744; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Item&nbsp;8.01 Other Events. On April&nbsp;12, 2018, the Board of Directors of Broadcom Inc., a Delaware corporation (the &#147;Company&#148;) authorized the repurchase by the Company of up to $12.0&nbsp;billion (the &#147;Repurchase Plan&#148;) of its common stock, par value $0.001 per share (the &#147;Common Stock&#148;) from time to time on or prior to November&nbsp;3, 2019, the end of the Company&#146;s fiscal year 2019. The Repurchase Plan may be effected through a variety of methods, including open market or privately negotiated purchases in compliance with Rule 10b-18 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. The timing and number of shares of Common Stock repurchased will depend on a variety of factors, including price, general business and market conditions and alternative investment opportunities. The Company&#146;s capital return program does not obligate it to repurchase any specific number of shares of Common Stock or continue a dividend for any fixed period, and may be suspended or discontinued at any time. &nbsp; Item&nbsp;9.01 Financial Statements and Exhibits. (d) Exhibits &nbsp; Exhibit Number &nbsp;&nbsp; Description 99.1 &nbsp;&nbsp; Press release, dated April&nbsp;12, 2018 SIGNATURE Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned, hereunto duly authorized. Date:&nbsp;April 12, 2018 &nbsp; Broadcom Inc. By: &nbsp; /s/ Thomas H. Krause, Jr. Name: &nbsp; Thomas H. Krause, Jr. Title: &nbsp; Chief Financial Officer
